title: Jenny Rissveds Joins Canyon CLLCTV Factory XC Team for 2025 Season
content:
After French powerhouse Loana Lecomte announced in late 2024 that she would be leaving the Canyon CLLCTV Factory XC Team. Fans wondered how Canyon CLLDTV would fill the top spot in the elite women’s roster. The answer is now clear, and it’s a big addition.

The Canyon CLLCTV Factory XC Team has unveiled its powerhouse roster for 2025 and signing of Olympic champion Jenny Rissveds. Known for her dynamic racing style and inspirational journey, the Swedish XC superstar brings world-class talent and leadership to an already stacked team.

Rissveds Recap 

Jenny Rissveds has been on a non-stop upward trajectory since returning to the mountain bike world stage in 2020. Her path back to the podium wasn’t an easy one. After winning gold at the 2016 Rio Olympics, Rissveds took a break from the sport, sighting burnout and other health issues. With this time away from the sport, Rissveds started her own team with a unique focus called Team31.

Team31 explains the inception story on their site, “The personal journey of Olympic Champion Jenny Rissveds inspired the creation of Team31. After overcoming a personal battle with eating disorders and depression, which caused her to leave cycling, she has returned to the sport and become a major proponent for mental health.”

Rissveds and Team 31 grew, becoming Team31-IBIS and eventually, she was back at the front of World Cup races, rarely out of podium contention. Rissveds continues to be one of the most captivating figures in world mountain biking.  With multiple World Cup victories and national titles to her name, the 30-year-old from Falun, Sweden, is ready for her next chapter. 

“I’m pleased about this new career phase,” she shared. “Joining the Canyon CLLCTV feels like the perfect opportunity to grow as a rider and continue pushing my limits.”

Jenny Rissveds

Blending Experience and Next-Gen Talent

Rissveds joins an impressive roster that balances seasoned professionals and emerging talents. Fan favorite, German powerhouse Luca Schwarzbauer returns, and French standout Thomas Griot. 

As for the young gun, the Canyon CLLCTV Factory XC U23 team is jam-packed with talent. Spanish rising star Thibaut François. Italian U23 national champion Valentina Corvi and French Junior sensation Noa Filippi will add fresh energy to the team.

“This lineup has everything we need to excel. With Jenny’s leadership and the incredible potential of Valentina and Noa, we’re ready to make a big impact on the World Cup circuit.”

Team Manager Sébastien Francois.

What to Expect in 2025

The team will ride the Canyon Lux World Cup CFR, designed for the rigorous demands of World Cup XC racing. With sights set on podiums, rainbow jerseys, and breakthrough performances, the Canyon CLLCTV Factory XC Team is primed for a landmark season.

Stay updated with Jenny Rissveds and Canyon CLLCTV Factory XC Team here: @canyon_cllctv on Instagram.

author: Jordan Villella
